article.title: Edge stability and edge quantum criticality in 2D interacting topological insulators

multiple_choice_question.text: What physical phenomenon does the presence of Rashba interaction allow in this figure?
choices: Single-particle backscattering in helical edge states
Two-particle forward-scattering in helical edge states
Two-particle spin-flip backscattering in helical edge states
Suppression of Coulomb interaction in helical edge states

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the intermediate region in this phase diagram represent?
choices: Both bulk and edge states are time-reversal invariant.
Both bulk and edge states break time-reversal symmetry.
The bulk remains time-reversal invariant while the edge states break time-reversal symmetry.
The edge states are time-reversal invariant while the bulk breaks time-reversal symmetry.

multiple_choice_question.text: What crucial aspect of the system does the last term in this formula describe?
choices: The kinetic energy of electrons on the edge
The Coulomb repulsion between electrons on the edge
The two-particle forward-scattering of electrons on the edge
The two-particle backscattering induced by the Rashba interaction

multiple_choice_question.text: According to this formula, when is the two-particle spin-flip backscattering irrelevant?
choices: When the Luttinger parameter K is less than 1/4
When the Luttinger parameter K is greater than 1/4
When the Hubbard interaction U is weak
When the Rashba interaction V is strong
